Vietnam: Trần Cao rebellion: Trần Cao, a mandarin of Đại Việt who identified himself as an incarnation of Śakra, launched a revolt against the government.
Lê Tương Dực was murdered in the capital by a group of palace guards.
Syria: The Ottoman Empire established its rule over Syria.
Spain: Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor, became King of Castile and Aragon.
Lebanon: The Ottoman Sultan Selim I grants Emir Fakhr ad-Din I a semi-autonomous reign in Lebanon.
China: The Portuguese explorer Rafael Perestrello arrived in Guangzhou.
Brazil: The first sugar cane mills appear in Pernambuco.
Argentina: Spanish navigator Juan Díaz de Solís first European explorer to visit Río de la Plata, on territory which is now Argentina; Díaz de Solís killed and supposedly cannibalised by native Charrúa, Querandí or Guaraní
